'''Michael Austin Cera''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|s|ɛr|ə}} {{respell|SERR|ə}}; {{IPA|it|ˈtʃeːra|lang}}; born June 7, 1988) is a Canadian actor. Over his career he has received nominations for a [[British Academy Film Awards|British Academy Film Award]], three [[Critics' Choice Movie Awards]], four [[Screen Actors Guild Awards]], and a [[Tony Award]]. 

Cera became known for portraying leading roles in a string of comedic films such as ''[[Superbad (film)|Superbad]]'' (2007), ''[[Juno (film)|Juno]]'' (2007), ''[[Scott Pilgrim vs. the World]]'' (2010), ''[[Nick & Norah's Infinite Playlist]]'' (2008), and ''[[Youth in Revolt (film)|Youth in Revolt]]'' (2009). He took supporting roles in both comedies and dramas including ''[[Confessions of a Dangerous Mind (film)|Confessions of a Dangerous Mind]]'' (2002), ''[[This Is the End]]'' (2013), ''[[Molly's Game]]'' (2017), ''[[Person to Person (film)|Person to Person]]'' (2017), ''[[Gloria Bell]]'' (2019), ''[[Barbie (film)|Barbie]]'' (2023), ''[[Dream Scenario]]'' (2023) and ''[[The Phoenician Scheme]]'' (2025). He voiced [[Dick Grayson]]/[[Robin (comics)|Robin]] in ''[[The Lego Batman Movie]]'' (2017). 

Cera gained prominence portraying [[List of Arrested Development characters|George Michael Bluth]] in the [[Fox Broadcasting Company|Fox]] [[sitcom]] ''[[Arrested Development]]'' from 2003 to 2006 and then again from 2013 to 2019. He took a leading role in the [[Hulu]] comedy series ''[[Life & Beth]]'' (2022–2024), and voiced roles including Brother Bear in the [[PBS]] children's series ''[[The Berenstain Bears (2003 TV series)|The Berenstain Bears]]'' and reprising his roles as [[Scott Pilgrim (character)|Scott Pilgrim]] in the [[Netflix]] series ''[[Scott Pilgrim Takes Off]]'' (2023) and Barry, a sausage in ''[[Sausage Party]]'' (2016) and its [[Amazon Prime Video]] sequel series ''[[Sausage Party: Foodtopia]]'' (2024).

Cera is also known for his [[Broadway (theatre)|Broadway]] performances in the [[Kenneth Lonergan]] plays ''[[This Is Our Youth]]'' in 2014, ''[[Lobby Hero]]'' in 2018, for which he received a nomination for the [[Tony Award for Best Performance by a Featured Actor in a Play|Tony Award for Best Featured Actor in a Play]], and ''[[The Waverly Gallery]]'' in 2019. In addition to acting, Cera is a musician, having released his debut album ''[[True That]]'' in 2014. Cera has also performed as the touring bassist for indie rock supergroup [[Mister Heavenly]].
